intro: Psychotria brachygyne, commonly known as the short-stalked psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are known for their ornamental or medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments, often found in rainforests. Psychotria brachygyne is also noted for its potential alkaloid content, which may have pharmacological significance.
